Topic.Title: Making a version of Quest for Chromebook

Posts.EditableText:
What would it require to make a version of the Quest game creation suite as an app for the Chromebook?

It would be something that can be used on Android devices.

Thanks.

I have some limited coding ability, and I have some friends that might be interested in helping as my story project grows.

Cheers.

Joshua

"-" egoproctor

Posts.EditableText:
https://blog.textadventures.co.uk/2012/03/17/add-quest-to-chrome/

This link leads to a blog post with a link that is dead.  

I can't get the website to let me start creating a text adventure in chrome, but it works for gamebooks.  is there something I need to do different with my browser setup?  I am using a chromebook, so it about the only browser I am going to have.
Posts.HTML:
https://blog.textadventures.co.uk/2012/03/17/add-quest-to-chrome/

This link leads to a blog post with a link that is dead.

I can't get the website to let me start creating a text adventure in chrome, but it works for gamebooks. is there something I need to do different with my browser setup? I am using a chromebook, so it about the only browser I am going to have.

Posts.EditableText:
Have you tried more than once?

My first guess would be that there was a server glitch when you tried to create a text adventure. I've used the site in chrome, chromium, konqueror, and even iLinks without problems.
Posts.HTML:
Have you tried more than once?

My first guess would be that there was a server glitch when you tried to create a text adventure. I've used the site in chrome, chromium, konqueror, and even iLinks without problems.

Posts.EditableText:
I just checked again, there is no create button in my browser under text adventure, but there is with the gamebook option.  I have installed Opera to create it in that environment.  I am, however, using Chrome OS, that may have something to do with it. 

I also searched and there was in 2012 an option to install Quest as an app or extension in chrome, and that has currently lost support.  

And someone else had issues with chrome in 2017, and there was no response about a fix.  Wondering if this has something to do with the way Chrome OS renders the pages.
Posts.HTML:
I just checked again, there is no create button in my browser under text adventure, but there is with the gamebook option. I have installed Opera to create it in that environment. I am, however, using Chrome OS, that may have something to do with it.

I also searched and there was in 2012 an option to install Quest as an app or extension in chrome, and that has currently lost support.

And someone else had issues with chrome in 2017, and there was no response about a fix. Wondering if this has something to do with the way Chrome OS renders the pages.
